title: Does anyone actually think riot is even attempting to balance this game?
body:
There is no way that a balance team can be this bad. There is no way you can actually say they are trying to balance this game when 3 or 4 champs can 1v5. 

How is it that yas has an amazing early game, and yet can 1v5 late game?

Are you even fucking trying? A monkey can balance your game better.

replies.body:
I'm curious if before making this thread you actually took into consideration the factors that went into him being able to 1v5. like the fact that he was 3-4 levels above everyone else, he was full build, he was a plat 4 yasuo main playing against all bronze players, yasuo is currently bugged, and only 1 person on your team built any armor. This was more of a problem with matchmaking and premades than it was with a specific champion.
what you should try to take from this rather than QQ about how unfair and unbalanced the game is, is learn what he did right in that game that made him capable of doing what he did, and try to improve yourself. 
See how he had 275 cs in a 35 minute game, while the highest on your team was over 100 less than that? CS is important. Put more focus on it.
So just out of curiosity, when i was an 11 kill karthus and died to a 0 kill fiddle while be up 4 levels and over 100 cs  i guess that matters if you only pick certain champs.
if you couldn't 1v1 someone when you had 4 levels and a 5k+ gold lead on them, that's a problem with you, not champion balance.
So what did i do wrong... enlighten me...  we ran into each other, i hit both q's before his ult went off...

Karthus's damage output can be pretty heavily neutered by fiddlesticks because of the amount of CC Fiddles has, and his ult does some pretty good damage to you too (and I think he can remain outside of your e's range while still nailing you with the edge of his ult).  1 v 1 battles are a terrible way of determining champion balance.
We'll need a replay or more information. Obviously you didn't do enough. 2 Qs and you stood there for the rest of the fight? We don't know runes, items, positioning....

The nature of the game makes it much harder to balace than say... DotA.
Which has more extremes in power levels and direct counter picks and such.

Not having these things makes the game fun, but it also means you have a lot less design space to work with. 
Without things like counter picks, at least not counter picks that are stronger than just picking the current OP champ.
You also can't just build items to make up for champion weakneses so much (the items are the most important thing in DotA)

So with a small design space and without the option for players to counter pick strong champions or build items to counter them they are stuck with a very difficult balance problem.
I remember back when I was low enough elo that I could 1v5 with Yasuo. Silver was fun. A shame that plat and diamond players aren't the same brain dead morons.
Want to list anyone besides Yasuo?
I wish I could down vote this more than once, also karthus isn't a good pick atm, if you like high dmg mids try vel koz his range and fast wave clear makes him pretty safe
fuck no i have silvers in my platinum game
I thought that was obvious a really long time ago? ofcourse they arent

Riot has outright admitted that they have no interest in balancing the game. They essentially just buff and nerf champions so that there's always a new group of meta picks every few weeks, with a bias toward flashy champs during tourny season.
